intro: Guarania gardneriana, commonly known as the Brazilian candlewood, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are alternate and palmately lobed, while its fruits are capsules that release seeds when mature. Guarania gardneriana is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
